content: I'm confused... +++http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/04/19/AR2009041901994.html New American presidents typically begin by behaving as if most of the world's problems are the fault of their predecessors -- and Barack Obama has been no exception. In his first three months he has quickly taken steps to correct the errors in George W. Bush's foreign policy, as seen by Democrats. He has collected easy dividends from his base, U.S. allies in Europe and a global following for not being "unilateralist" or war-mongering or scornful of dialogue with enemies. This Story What Burma Needs From the White House Who Will Face Down the Gun Lobby? A World Of Trouble For Obama Now comes the interesting part: when it starts to become evident that Bush did not create rogue states, terrorist movements, Middle Eastern blood feuds or Russian belligerence -- and that shake-ups in U.S. diplomacy, however enlightened, might not have much impact on them.
reply: I'm confused... +++http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/04/19/AR2009041901994.html New American presidents typically begin by behaving as if most of the world's problems are the fault of their predecessors -- and Barack Obama has been no exception. In his first three months he has quickly taken steps to correct the errors in George W. Bush's foreign policy, as seen by Democrats. He has collected easy dividends from his base, U.S. allies in Europe and a global following for not being "unilateralist" or war-mongering or scornful of dialogue with enemies. This Story What Burma Needs From the White House Who Will Face Down the Gun Lobby? A World Of Trouble For Obama Now comes the interesting part: when it starts to become evident that Bush did not create rogue states, terrorist movements, Middle Eastern blood feuds or Russian belligerence -- and that shake-ups in U.S. diplomacy, however enlightened, might not have much impact on them.

content: Here is what i'm saying: President Obama's Talk, Listen, and Apologize doctrine is a damn joke when Iran is telling us how wrong we are, how evil we are, and how impotent we are....They are simply scoring propaganda victories, and continuing their nuclear activities. title: Bush...didn't cause Middle East violence???

content: quote: Originally posted by Thud357L: quote: Originally posted by threerings: quote: Originally posted by Thud357L: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: The Talk, Listen, and Apologize doctrine doesn't have a chance in hell of working, none. On the other hand, we still have a massive Military capability, and Israeli allies... I don't think you quite get the picture yet. Pot, Meet kettle. Perhaps you would care to enlighten? I'd say that you're the one who, based on your complete lack of experience with arab muslims, fails to get the picture. We are in a war. Terror is a TOOL. 9-11 gained for our enemies exactly what was needed. 9-11 was a propaganda win, a recruting win, a prestige win for the enemies of America. They know they cannot hope to engage us directly. We have not been hit again, simply because they dont need too. They've done enough on that front. The war now is being fought in our courts, in our newspapers, in the court of public opinion. The goal of OBL and his ilk never was, never could be to destroy us from without. It is to destroy us from within. To subvert our culture. To reduce our will to fight. And given how weak and cowardly we've become, I doubt our ability to win. In this regard the forces of our far left and even those of soem moderate lefts have helped them. When homeland defense allows 1000's of illegals into this nation (just to build a voting block for the dem's) they further aid our enemies by weaking the culture that built this nation. When homeland defense calls returning soldiers traitors and a danger..they weaken us yet again, by attempting to marginalize a block of would be GOP voters and branding them anti-american. When Nancy Pelosi calls for harsher techinqies to be used in the WOT and then, years later calls for those people to face justice for doing exaclty what she wanted..well you see the point and the pattern.

When Nancy Pelosi calls for harsher techinqies to be used in the WOT and then, years later calls for those people to face justice for doing exaclty what she wanted..well you see the point and the pattern. I've never spent any time in the sand but I live about 10 minutes away from Dearborn, Michigan which is the Muslim capitol of America, meaning more Muslims live here than any other place outside the ME. I've worked with some of these folks on various projects and actually call some of them friends. I've had discussions with people who are as American as you are and voted for Bush. I've talked to people who support Hamas and hate Israel. Some of them are very religious, some not so much. So I don't know any Muslims in Arabia but I do know some Arab Muslims. Just said that to show you how you tend to jump to unwarranted conclusions and operate on false projections that inevitably force you into irrelevant and wrong end results. You once again fall victim to you ideological filter which forces you to exonerate the right wing when they're guilty as sin and forces you to blame everything on the left - which may also be guilty as sin. In other words, you either tell deliberate lies to score propaganda points, or you really are incapable of fair and honest observations. Your above post is fairly coherent until this paragraph: In this regard the forces of our far left and even those of soem moderate lefts have helped them. When homeland defense allows 1000's of illegals into this nation (just to build a voting block for the dem's) they further aid our enemies by weaking the culture that built this nation. When homeland defense calls returning soldiers traitors and a danger..they weaken us yet again, by attempting to marginalize a block of would be GOP voters and branding them anti-american. When Nancy Pelosi calls for harsher techinqies to be used in the WOT and then, years later calls for those people to face justice for doing exaclty what she wanted..well you see the point and the pattern. That's so full of conjecture, half truths and outright lies that I hardly know where to begin. Thousands of illegals in the country just to build a voting block for Democrats? Do you really believe that crap? Is it really true that the right wing has absolutely no hand in this and has nothing to gain like for instance cheap labor that will never ask for a raise or unionize? Can illegals vote here? No. Can they work and undercut American wages and deprive Americans of jobs? Certainly. Maybe you'd care to define that one culture that built this nation. I think it was many cultures that define American culture as a whole. Your whole take on returning Soldiers has been thoroughly discredited and deserves no further comment. Pelosi? Well, that still has to play out. I think if she and others were sworn to secrecy (if true) makes the rest of your argument invalid. How you can just ignore 8 years of incompetency by the red team and blame all our ills on the heretofore powerless left wing is amusing at best and troubling at worst. Maybe it's just an inability to admit that your guys have objectively screwed the proverbial pooch on multiple occasions with vigor and enthusiasm. You want to take the blowback from their multitude of mistakes and blame it on the guys who have to clean it up. That's just dishonest. If you want to debate then at least approach with a bit of integrity. Basing your argument on distortions and lies means you build your castle by the water on a base of sand. It won't last very long and it may be difficult to resurrect.

Is it really true that the right wing has absolutely no hand in this and has nothing to gain like for instance cheap labor that will never ask for a raise or unionize? Can illegals vote here? No. Can they work and undercut American wages and deprive Americans of jobs? Certainly. Maybe you'd care to define that one culture that built this nation. I think it was many cultures that define American culture as a whole. Your whole take on returning Soldiers has been thoroughly discredited and deserves no further comment. Pelosi? Well, that still has to play out. I think if she and others were sworn to secrecy (if true) makes the rest of your argument invalid. How you can just ignore 8 years of incompetency by the red team and blame all our ills on the heretofore powerless left wing is amusing at best and troubling at worst. Maybe it's just an inability to admit that your guys have objectively screwed the proverbial pooch on multiple occasions with vigor and enthusiasm. You want to take the blowback from their multitude of mistakes and blame it on the guys who have to clean it up. That's just dishonest. If you want to debate then at least approach with a bit of integrity. Basing your argument on distortions and lies means you build your castle by the water on a base of sand. It won't last very long and it may be difficult to resurrect.
title: Bush...didn't cause Middle East violence???

content: quote: Originally posted by Thud357L: quote: Originally posted by threerings: quote: Originally posted by Thud357L: quote: Originally posted by threerings: quote: Originally posted by Thud357L: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: The Talk, Listen, and Apologize doctrine doesn't have a chance in hell of working, none. On the other hand, we still have a massive Military capability, and Israeli allies... I don't think you quite get the picture yet. Pot, Meet kettle. Perhaps you would care to enlighten? I'd say that you're the one who, based on your complete lack of experience with arab muslims, fails to get the picture. We are in a war. Terror is a TOOL. 9-11 gained for our enemies exactly what was needed. 9-11 was a propaganda win, a recruting win, a prestige win for the enemies of America. They know they cannot hope to engage us directly. We have not been hit again, simply because they dont need too. They've done enough on that front. The war now is being fought in our courts, in our newspapers, in the court of public opinion. The goal of OBL and his ilk never was, never could be to destroy us from without. It is to destroy us from within. To subvert our culture. To reduce our will to fight. And given how weak and cowardly we've become, I doubt our ability to win. In this regard the forces of our far left and even those of soem moderate lefts have helped them. When homeland defense allows 1000's of illegals into this nation (just to build a voting block for the dem's) they further aid our enemies by weaking the culture that built this nation. When homeland defense calls returning soldiers traitors and a danger..they weaken us yet again, by attempting to marginalize a block of would be GOP voters and branding them anti-american. When Nancy Pelosi calls for harsher techinqies to be used in the WOT and then, years later calls for those people to face justice for doing exaclty what she wanted..well you see the point and the pattern. I've never spent any time in the sand... snipped for brevity and to avoid repeating stupidity. The last sentence pretty much explains the posters lack of knowledge on the subject of terrorists and terrorism in the Middle East. While I have never been there, many close to me have been on multiple tours, and they are all very concerned/pizzed off at what they see is Barry and his crew of criminal, liberal appeasement apologist clowns branding returning soldiers as dangerous, Christian Conservatives as 'radical terrorists' and attempting turning the military victory won in Iraq into defeat, weakening our nation's defenses by cutting funding for needed military weaponry and pay, stealing tax payers money to fund pet pork projects, bowing/groveling to every tin-horn tyrant and opening this nation up to another attack that will make 9/11 look like a minor dust-up.
